findings.remediation: Enable MFA for all user accounts in Azure AD.
findings.title: MFA enabled for user
findings.whyItMatters: MFA reduces account takeover risk by requiring additional authentication factors.

findings.remediation: Configure Authenticator app, FIDO2, or Windows Hello for Business as MFA methods.
findings.title: Phishing-resistant MFA methods configured
findings.whyItMatters: Phishing-resistant methods prevent SMS-based attacks and provide stronger security.

findings.remediation: Enable Microsoft Authenticator app as an MFA method for users.
findings.title: Authenticator app method available
findings.evaluationResult: Contains check failed: value is not array or string
findings.whyItMatters: Authenticator apps provide better security than SMS-based MFA.

findings.remediation: Review and properly assign administrative roles to users.
findings.title: User has administrative roles
findings.whyItMatters: Administrative roles should be properly assigned and monitored.

findings.remediation: Ensure user accounts are properly enabled for access.
findings.title: User account is enabled
findings.whyItMatters: Enabled accounts can be used for authentication and access.

findings.remediation: Limit Global Administrator role assignments to 2-5 accounts maximum.
findings.title: Global Administrator count within limits
findings.evaluationResult: Array length check failed: value is not an array
findings.whyItMatters: Too many Global Administrators increases security risk and attack surface.

findings.remediation: Ensure all users have valid User Principal Names configured.
findings.title: User Principal Name is valid
findings.whyItMatters: Valid UPN is required for user identification and authentication.
